docs.title: What is Payload?
docs.label: What is Payload?
docs.desc: Payload is a next-gen headless Content Management System (CMS) and application framework.
docs.keywords: documentation, getting started, guide, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Payload Concepts
docs.label: Concepts
docs.desc: Payload is based around a small and intuitive set of concepts. Key concepts include collections, globals, fields and more.
docs.keywords: documentation, getting started, guide, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Installation
docs.label: Installation
docs.desc: To quickly get started with Payload, simply run npx create-payload-app or install from scratch.
docs.keywords: documentation, getting started, guide, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: The Payload Config
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: The Payload config is central to everything that Payload does, from adding custom React components, to modifying collections, controlling localization and much more.
docs.keywords: overview, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

headings.text: Using environment variables in your config

docs.title: Collection Configs
docs.label: Collections
docs.desc: Structure your Collections for your needs by defining fields, adding slugs and labels, establishing access control, tying in hooks, setting timestamps and more.
docs.keywords: collections, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Global Configs
docs.label: Globals
docs.desc: Set up your Global config for your needs by defining fields, adding slugs and labels, establishing access control, tying in hooks and more.
docs.keywords: globals, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: I18n
docs.label: I18n
docs.desc: Manage and customize internationalization support in your CMS editor experience
docs.keywords: internationalization, i18n, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Localization
docs.label: Localization
docs.desc: Add and maintain as many locales as you need by adding Localization to your Payload config, set options for default locale, fallbacks, fields and more.
docs.keywords: localization, internationalization, i18n, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Express
docs.label: Express
docs.desc: Payload utilizes Express middleware packages, you can customize how they work by passing in configuration options.
docs.keywords: config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Fields Overview
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: Fields are the building blocks of Payload, find out how to add or remove a field, change field type, add hooks, define access control and validation.
docs.keywords: overview, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Array Field
docs.label: Array
docs.desc: Array fields are intended for sets of repeating fields, that you define. Learn how to use array fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: array, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Blocks Field
docs.label: Blocks
docs.desc: The Blocks field type is a great layout build and can be used to construct any flexible content model. Learn how to use Block fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: blocks, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Checkbox Field
docs.label: Checkbox
docs.desc: Checkbox field types allow the developer to save a boolean value in the database. Learn how to use Checkbox fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: checkbox, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Code Field
docs.label: Code
docs.desc: The Code field type will store any string in the Database. Learn how to use Code fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: code, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: JSON Field
docs.label: JSON
docs.desc: The JSON field type will store any string in the Database. Learn how to use JSON fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: json, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Collapsible Field
docs.label: Collapsible
docs.desc: With the Collapsible field, you can place fields within a collapsible layout component that can be collapsed / expanded.
docs.keywords: row, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Date Field
docs.label: Date
docs.desc: The Date field type stores a Date in the database. Learn how to use and customize the Date field, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: date, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Email Field
docs.label: Email
docs.desc: The Email field enforces that the value provided is a valid email address. Learn how to use Email fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: email, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Group Field
docs.label: Group
docs.desc: The Group field allows other fields to be nested under a common property. Learn how to use Group fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: group, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Number Field
docs.label: Number
docs.desc: Number fields store and validate numeric data. Learn how to use and format Number fields, see examples and Number field options.
docs.keywords: number, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Point Field
docs.label: Point
docs.desc: The Point field type stores coordinates in the database. Learn how to use Point field for geolocation and geometry.
docs.keywords: point, geolocation, geospatial, geojson, 2dsphere, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Radio Group Field
docs.label: Radio Group
docs.desc: The Radio field type allows for the selection of one value from a predefined set of possible values. Learn how to use Radio fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: radio, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Relationship Field
docs.label: Relationship
docs.desc: The Relationship field provides the ability to relate documents together. Learn how to use Relationship fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: relationship, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Rich Text Field
docs.label: Rich Text
docs.desc: The Rich Text field allows dynamic content to be written through the Admin Panel. Learn how to use Rich Text fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: rich text, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

headings.text: Specifying which elements and leaves to allow

docs.title: Row Field
docs.label: Row
docs.desc: With the Row field you can arrange fields next to each other in the Admin Panel to help you customize your Dashboard.
docs.keywords: row, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Select Field
docs.label: Select
docs.desc: The Select field provides a dropdown-style interface for choosing options from a predefined list. Learn how to use Select fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: select, multi-select, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Tabs Field
docs.label: Tabs
docs.desc: The Tabs field is a great way to organize complex editing experiences into specific tab-based areas.
docs.keywords: tabs, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Text Field
docs.label: Text
docs.desc: Text field types simply save a string to the database and provide the Admin panel with a text input. Learn how to use Text fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: text, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Textarea Field
docs.label: Textarea
docs.desc: Textarea field types save a string to the database, similar to the Text field type but equipped for longer text. Learn how to use Textarea fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: textarea, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: UI Field
docs.label: UI
docs.desc: UI fields are purely presentational and allow developers to customize the admin panel to a very fine degree, including adding actions and other functions.
docs.keywords: custom field, react component, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Upload Field
docs.label: Upload
docs.desc: Upload fields will allow a file to be uploaded, only from a collection supporting Uploads. Learn how to use Upload fields, see examples and options.
docs.keywords: upload, images media, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: The Admin Panel
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: Manage your data and customize the Admin Panel by swapping in your own React components. Create, modify or remove views, fields, styles and much more.
docs.keywords: admin, components, custom, customize, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Swap in your own React components
docs.label: Custom Components
docs.desc: Fully customize your Admin Panel by swapping in your own React components. Add fields, remove views, update routes and change functions to sculpt your perfect Dashboard.
docs.keywords: admin, components, custom, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

headings.text: Sending and receiving values from the form

docs.title: React Hooks
docs.label: React Hooks
docs.desc: Make use of all of the powerful React hooks that Payload provides.
docs.keywords: admin, components, custom, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Customizing CSS & SCSS
docs.label: Customizing CSS
docs.desc: Customize your Payload admin panel further by adding your own CSS or SCSS style sheet to the configuration, powerful theme and design options are waiting for you.
docs.keywords: admin, css, scss, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Managing User Preferences
docs.label: Preferences
docs.desc: Store the preferences of your users as they interact with the Admin panel.
docs.keywords: admin, preferences, custom, customize, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

headings.text: Adding or reading Preferences in your own components

docs.title: Webpack
docs.label: Webpack
docs.desc: The Payload admin panel uses Webpack 5 and supports many common functionalities such as SCSS and Typescript out of the box to give you more freedom.
docs.keywords: admin, webpack, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Access Control
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: Payload makes it simple to define and manage access control. By declaring roles, you can set permissions and restrict what your users can interact with.
docs.keywords: overview, access control, permissions, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Collection Access Control
docs.label: Collections
docs.desc: With Collection-level Access Control you can define which users can create, read, update or delete Collections.
docs.keywords: collections, access control, permissions, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Field-level Access Control
docs.label: Fields
docs.desc: Field-level Access Control is specified within a field's config, and allows you to define which users can create, read or update Fields.
docs.keywords: fields, access control, permissions, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Globals Access Control
docs.label: Globals
docs.desc: Global-level Access Control is specified within each Global's `access` property and allows you to define which users can read or update Globals.
docs.keywords: globals, access control, permissions, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Hooks Overview
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: Hooks allow you to add your own logic to Payload, including integrating with third-party APIs, adding auto-generated data, or modifing Payload's base functionality.
docs.keywords: hooks, overview, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Collection Hooks
docs.label: Collections
docs.desc: You can add hooks to any Collection, several hook types are available including beforeChange, afterRead, afterDelete and more.
docs.keywords: hooks, collections, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Field Hooks
docs.label: Fields
docs.desc: Hooks can be added to any fields, and optionally modify the return value of the field before the operation continues.
docs.keywords: hooks, fields, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Global Hooks
docs.label: Globals
docs.desc: Hooks can be added to any Global and allow you to validate data, flatten locales, hide protected fields, remove fields and more.
docs.keywords: hooks, globals, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Authentication Overview
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: Payload provides highly secure user Authentication out of the box, and you can fully customize, override, or remove the default Authentication support.
docs.keywords: authentication, config, configuration, overview, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

headings.text: Logging in / out, resetting password, etc.
Identifying users via the Authorization Header

docs.title: Authentication Config
docs.label: Config
docs.desc: Enable and customize options in the Authentication config for features including Forgot Password, Login Attempts, API key usage and more.
docs.keywords: authentication, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Authentication Operations
docs.label: Operations
docs.desc: Enabling Authentication automatically makes key operations available such as Login, Logout, Verify, Unlock, Reset Password and more.
docs.keywords: authentication, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Using the Payload Auth Middleware
docs.label: Using the Middleware
docs.desc: Make full use of Payload's built-in authentication with your own custom Express endpoints by adding Payload's authentication middleware.
docs.keywords: authentication, middleware, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Versions
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: Keep a version history or audit log of changes and publish collection documents and globals.
docs.keywords: version history, revisions, audit log, draft, publish, restore, autosave, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Drafts
docs.label: Drafts
docs.desc: Enable drafts on collection documents or globals and build true preview environments for your data.
docs.keywords: version history, drafts, preview, draft, restore, publish, autosave, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

headings.text: Controlling who can see Collection drafts

docs.title: Autosave
docs.label: Autosave
docs.desc: Using Payload's Draft functionality, you can configure your collections and globals to autosave changes as drafts, and publish only you're ready.
docs.keywords: version history, revisions, audit log, draft, publish, autosave, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, expresss

docs.title: Uploads
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: Payload supports uploads, storage and management of files directly on your server, combined with powerful file access control.
docs.keywords: uploads, images, media, overview, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: GraphQL Overview
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: Payload ships with a fully featured and extensible GraphQL API, which can be used in addition to the REST and Local APIs to give you more flexibility.
docs.keywords: graphql, resolvers, mutations, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Adding your own Queries and Mutations
docs.label: Custom Queries and Mutations
docs.desc: Payload allows you to add your own GraphQL queries and mutations, simply set up GraphQL in your main Payload config by following these instructions.
docs.keywords: graphql, resolvers, mutations, custom, queries, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: GraphQL Schema
docs.label: GraphQL Schema
docs.desc: Output your own GraphQL schema based on your collections and globals to a file.
docs.keywords: headless cms, typescript, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: REST API
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: Payload generates a fully functional REST API from your Collection and Global configs.
docs.keywords: rest, api, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Local API
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: The Payload Local API allows you to interact with your database and execute the same operations that are available through REST and GraphQL within Node, directly on your server.
docs.keywords: local api, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Querying your Documents
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: Payload provides a querying language through all APIs, allowing you to filter or search through documents within a Collection.
docs.keywords: query, documents, overview, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Pagination
docs.label: Pagination
docs.desc: Payload queries are equipped with automatic pagination so you create paginated lists of documents within your app.
docs.keywords: query, documents, pagination, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Production Deployment
docs.label: Deployment
docs.desc: When your Payload based app is ready, tested, looking great, it is time to deploy. Learn how to deploy your app and what to consider before deployment.
docs.keywords: deployment, production, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Preventing Production API Abuse
docs.label: Preventing Abuse
docs.desc: Payload has built-in security that can be configured to combat production API abuse such as limiting login attempts and IP requests.
docs.keywords: abuse, production, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Email Functionality
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: Payload uses NodeMailer to allow you to send emails smoothly from your app. Set up email functions such as password resets, order confirmations and more.
docs.keywords: email, overview, config, configuration, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: TypeScript - Overview
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: Payload is the most powerful TypeScript headless CMS available.
docs.keywords: headless cms, typescript, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Generating TypeScript Interfaces
docs.label: Generating Types
docs.desc: Generate your own TypeScript interfaces based on your collections and globals.
docs.keywords: headless cms, typescript, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express

docs.title: Plugins
docs.label: Overview
docs.desc: Plugins provide a great way to modularize Payload functionalities into easy-to-use enhancements and extensions of your Payload apps.
docs.keywords: plugins, config, configuration, extensions, custom, documentation, Content Management System, cms, headless, javascript, node, react, express
